713961f-a.title: Manhattan: 58th Street (East) - Madison Avenue
713961f-a.text:
28 East 58th Street, adjoining the S.W. corner of Madison Avenue.
About 1912.

721403f-a.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 58th Street
721403f-a.text:
Madison Avenue at N.W. corner of 58th Street, the old Sydenham
Building, originally Madison Avenue Hotel, shortly to be torn
down and replaced by The Madison, residential hotel.
About 1922.

713958f-a.title: Manhattan: 58th Street (East) - Madison Avenue
713958f-a.text:
E. 58th Street (diagonally from left foreground to
rimht marginJ, north side, at Madison Avenue, as viewed north-
eastward from No. 5 E. 57th Street and showing a new structure
under construction on the east side of the Avenue, from 58th
to 59th Streets. Across same apnears the towered Hotel Delmonico
at ark Avenue and 59th Street.
Aumst 15, 1929.
'.L. Sperr

713959f-a.title: Manhattan: 58th Street - Madison Avenue
713959f-a.text:
58th Street, at and adjoining S.E. corner of Madison Avenue, from
clearing on N.E. corner.
June 5, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

721402f-a.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 58th Street
721402f-a.text:
Madison Avenue at N.E. corner of 58th Street, showing present
building under construction.
August 15, 1929.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

721406f-a.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 58th Street
721406f-a.text:
Madison Avenue at N.W. corner of 58th Street, showing the 58th
Street side of the Madison apartment hotel, as seen from the
roof of 5 East 57th Street.
August 15, 1929.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

713960f-a.title: Manhattan: 58th Street (East) - Madison Avenue
713960f-a.text:
42-44 East 58th Street, south side, east of Madison Avenue. This
building will stand until between 1925 and 1930, when it will
give way to the Plaza Theatre.
About 1V20.
0ift of E. M. Jenke.

713956f-a.title: Manhattan: 58th Street - Madison Avenue
713956f-a.text:
58th Street, south side, west from Madison Avenue.
September 2, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

713962f-a.title: Manhattan: 58th Street - Madison Avenue
713962f-a.text:
58th Street, Madison to 5th Avenue.
(Before reconstruction).
Presdent Borough of Manlatten.
urIr I RE IgTETATTIVE.  March 12, 1218.

1557972-a.title: Madison Avenue - East 58th Street
1557972-a.folder: Madison Avenue - East 58th Street, Manhattan, NY

1557973-a.title: Madison Avenue - East 58th Street
1557973-a.folder: Madison Avenue - East 58th Street, Manhattan, NY

721405f-a.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 58th Street
721405f-a.text:
Madison Avenue, east side, north from 58th Street, showing Plaza
Theatre (old Lenox Lyceum). Block will be demolished the
following year.
May 3, 1928.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

721407f-a.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 58th Street
721407f-a.text:
(1)
Madison Avenue, west side, from 58th to 61st Streets. On the
N.W. corner of 59th Street is the old Hoffman Arms, which will
be demolished about 1933. It is supposed to be a little
over fifty years old.
June 14, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, a closer view of the Hoffman Arme, taken the previous
fall.
October 21, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

721407f-b.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 58th Street
721407f-b.text:
(1)
Madison Avenue, west side, from 58th to 61st Streets. On the
N.W. corner of 59th Street is the old Hoffman Arms, which will
be demolished about 1933. It is supposed to be a little
over fifty years old.
June 14, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, a closer view of the Hoffman Arme, taken the previous
fall.
October 21, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
